Business Requirement Document (BRD) Commercial Bank of Dubai
Head of Finance Planning & Performance Planning & Performance
Alan O'Neill Sign off

 2.1. COMPLIANCE QUESTIONNAIRE FOR BRD

If the answer to any of the questions below is "YES", then Compliance approval is required for the BRD. Else if the answer to all questions is "NO", there is normally no need to obtain Compliance approval for the BRD, unless the requester wants to run through compliance because of some specific condition.

3D Secure Ecommerce transactions are done on Credit and Debit cards. Customer Authentication process – NTB customers, Due Diligence, Transaction Approvals, High Risk and High Value transaction completion. Please list key business processes within the bank impacted by the proposed document:

- Login to Online banking channels.
- Location based Login on Mobile App.
- Restriction of channels via Mobile App.
- IVR Application – Customer Authentication Via OTP and TPIN replacement with Soft token.

Please list key systems within the bank impacted by the proposed document:

- Applications (Fiserv, IST Switch)
- VCAS – 3D Secure Vendor
- PING – Channel Authentication Application
- Mobile Banking App
- Mule Soft
- EDW
- IVR

Please specify the main reason(s) for the proposed change (e.g.: regulatory requirement, process improvement, additional control etc.)

__data__.text:
3. INTRODUCTION

 3.1. Objectives, Background and Drivers

 Objective:

As part of the CB Notice 3057.2025 (Prevention of Fraud Incidents), it has been mandated to LFI’s to enhance the supporting channels to ensure regulatory compliance by improving customer data privacy, consent management, transaction transparency, and authentication protocols.

The primary objectives are to fortify customer authentication, restrict sensitive operations to trusted devices, enable swift response to emerging threats, and improve user convenience through new functionalities.

 Background:

In May 2025, the UAE Central Bank issued Notice 3057/2025 which outlines new compliance requirements for financial institutions offering digital banking services. The notice focuses on strengthening customer data handling, providing transparency around transaction fees, and introducing stricter authentication for sensitive operations where all LFI’s servicing customers through digital channels should comply on or before 31 March 2026.

These measures are part of the regulator's broader effort to ensure a secure and transparent digital banking environment.

__data__.text: BRD: UAE Central bank Notice 3057-2025 - Channel enhancements V7.0

Business Requirement Document (BRD)

 Commercial Bank of Dubai

 Audit

Yes CBD’s internal and CBUAE audit ratings will get impacted due to non-compliance of regulatory mandate if not implemented as per the guidelines received.

 Regulatory Compliance & Reputational Risk:

Non-compliance CBUAE Mandate

 Others

 Risk

Financial Risk: CBUAE may impose penalties (if applicable) for the non-compliance of the regulatory mandate.

 3.2. Project Scope

The scope of the project is to ensure that the channel Level changes are enabled to be compliant with the central bank notice CB Notice 3057.2025 (Prevention of Fraud Incidents).

 3.2.1. In Scope

- 3D Secure Transaction Display & Completion via In-App Approvals.
- Implement Trusted Device integration for Mobile Banking users with EFR Authentication
- New to bank customers on First Login to Mobile App to be triggered with Trusted Device enablement journey Via EFR.
- Existing to bank customers on First Login to Mobile App (post EFR Authentication enabled on the CBD Mobile App) to be triggered with Trusted Device enablement journey Via EFR.
- High Risks and High Value transactions via the CBD Channels to be allowed only from devices flagged as Trusted.
- Online banking Login to be allowed with In App Authentication only from devices flagged as Trusted.
- Ongoing due Diligence (ODD) to be allowed only from devices flagged as Trusted.
- Beneficiary Addition to be allowed only from devices flagged as Trusted.
- Enrolling in Instant payment Solutions – AANI Registration, Open Finance Registration and Digital Wallet Registrations from CBD Mobile App to be allowed only from devices flagged as Trusted.
- Enable functionality to Suspend session for screen share, malicious code/malware, active call.
- Completion of high value/ high-risk transactions on Mobile App via In App Approval. Send push-notification to device when a customer attempts any high value or high-risk financial transaction or make amendments to their online or mobile accounts, prompting them to approve or deny the operation with clear informational messages.
- For international transfers (Wherever Possible), name of the payee, account number, bank details and type of account (personal or corporate) whenever available to the consumer before confirming the transaction.
- Channels Usage Limit (CVM Limits) Management via Mobile App.
- Implement functionality to view and manage recurring payment subscriptions.
- Implement “Safe Block” functionality to block all accounts and Cards.
- Implement Geofencing enablement via Channels.
- Enable Wallet extension / Tap to add via Samsung and Google pay.
- Enabling Push Notifications for Non-Financial Transactions & Marketing communications and all mobile App Notifications currently sent as SMS.
- IVR related enhancements to replace journeys where SMS OTP is sent to customers along with alternate solution for TPIN.

 3.2.2. Out of Scope

BRD: UAE Central bank Notice 3057-2025 - Channel enhancements V7.0

Classification: Internal
Business Requirement Document (BRD) Commercial Bank of Dubai

• No changes or enhancements will be made to online banking via web portals or desktop platforms, outside the context of device trust checks linked to mobile app usage.

• Creation of new dashboards or advanced reporting tools for user actions, transaction patterns, or device management is excluded.

• Users who are allowed to log in to Mobile App but do not have active debit/ Credit card.

• Handling of 3D secure transactions when CBD App is having scheduled downtime - User should be able to continue with the existing OTP based solution.

 3.3. Assumptions, Constraints and Risks

 3.3.1. Assumptions

- Users will have compatible devices that support secure biometric authentication and the necessary app updates.
- The backend systems and databases will be able to handle the increased load from new features and logging requirements.
- Users will have stable internet connections for real-time authentication and transaction processing.
- The integration with third-party services (e.g., Bankers Almanach, Visa SDK, VCAS, EFR) will be seamless and without significant delays.
- Users will follow the recommended security practices, such as not sharing their authentication credentials.

 3.3.2. Constraints

- The project must be completed within the specified six-month timeline with Go-Live date as end of Q1, 2026.
- The mobile app enhancements must comply with existing security and regulatory standards.
- The app must maintain a high level of performance, even with the addition of new features.

 3.3.3. Risks

- Potential delays in third-party integrations could impact on the project timeline.
- Users may face difficulties adapting to new authentication methods, leading to increased support requests.
- Security vulnerabilities could be introduced with the new features, risking data breaches.
- High concurrency during peak times might lead to system performance issues.
- Regulatory changes during the project could require significant adjustments to the requirements.
- There are multiple vendors/partners involved in this program. CBD must align the delivery of the program with all the other vendors as well to avoid any delays.

 4. BUSINESS PROCESS OVERVIEW

 4.1. Current Business Process (As-Is)

The requirements captured in this BRD are new Enhancements to the Mobile App.

 4.2. Proposed Business Process (To-Be)

Once the Soft token is entered, following handlings to be developed on the Page: - - Error message if Soft Token has expired - Error message if soft token is Incorrect. Post 3 Times incorrect soft token entered and Validated by PING, VCAS to be notified to block the Card for Exceeding Pin tries. - Error message on Page time out. The existing Phase 1 implementation of soft token registration and generation (Refer Appendix Section 7.5 which has the Phase 1 BRD) should also continue in parallel to support customers to complete the 3D secure transactions via soft tokens. This is to support use cases where there are no internet connections / Restricted countries/ Offline mode/ if user for some reason is not receiving push notifications. ', 1: ' Implement Trusted Device integration for Mobile Banking users with EFR Authentication. The mobile app must be enhanced to support the users to register their mobile devices as trusted, linking device identity with their banking profile.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          ', 2: ' EFR Authentication Integration: The system shall employ EFR Authentication during device registration and every access attempt for robust identity verification as part of Trusted Device enablement. Device binding should never be permitted without successful EFR.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                ', 3: ' If EFR fails for any reason, the system must provide retry opportunity (Parameterized Attempts). If the retry attempt also fails, the customer should be advised as below but not limited to: • Move to a better-lit area, • Switch to a location with a stronger network connection, • Or otherwise improve their environment for EFR success.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       ', 4: ' Device Binding: The solution shall generate a unique, secure device identifier for each registered device, stored securely in the bank’s backend system to ensure that there is a deep secure connection enabled between the Device, the user and the Mobile App credentials. Note: Triggers should be sent Threatmetrix for behavioral monitoring and decisioning to allow / decline binding the device as trusted. The Secured                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      '}}

Once the device has been successfully bound using EFR, then only Smart PIN functionality should be setup for accessing through that bound device. (This Pin will be used as alternate for #D secure Authentications where device Biometric is not supported or Biometric Authentication fails – Refer FR001.3)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      ', 1: ' Multi-Device Support: Users shall have the ability to register and manage multiple trusted devices under a single banking profile, with clear visibility and revocation controls. Device Management Portal: The system shall provide a secure interface within the mobile banking app or online portal for users to disable and deregister their trusted devices. A user can register up to 2 Devices as Trusted device. When user is registering the Second device, as part of successful Registration process and first Login to the device, Device binding process to be Initiated. EFR Authentication to be initiated for any new Trusted device enablement / deregistering a device and later attempt to register the same device again. User will have to disable either of the already added devices to add a new device as trusted, i.e. only 2 trusted devices to be active at any instance. If the user tries to reenable a device as trusted (which was enabled and later disabled), user will still need to perform ERF integration. ', 2: ' Disabling of trusted devices will need to pass through EFR Authentication, and the information should be passed to Threatmetrix application for behavioral monitoring and decisioning to allow / decline binding the device as trusted. Remote Device Revocation via OPCRM: The bank shall offer the capability to remotely revoke or disable a trusted device in case of loss, theft, or suspicious activity, requiring re-authentication for future access.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    ', 3: ' Periodic Re-Authentication: Users may be periodically prompted for EFR re-authentication on trusted devices to ensure ongoing security and to mitigate session hijacking risks.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ', 4: ' Seamless User Experience: The trusted device registration and authentication processes shall be intuitive and minimally intrusive, balancing security with user convenience.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     '}}

- Similarly, over 90% of Transfers / Payments are under 10k AED.User Journey on completion of high value/ high-risk transactions In App Approval on Mobile App: -1) **Step 1: Initiate Action** The user selects a high-risk, non-financial transaction (e.g., password change, reveal card details) from the CBD Mobile App or Online banking Platform.
2) **Step 2: Authentication Prompt** The application (Mobile or Online banking) detects the high-risk / High Value action and immediately displays an authentication prompt to the customer on the Mobile App. If Initiated from Online banking – Online banking to display the summary of the updates to user. Application to Send push-notification to users registered device, display the details of the transactions to be displayed to the user with option to Approve or decline the transaction prompting them to approve or deny the operation with clear informational messages. The details of the transactions to be displayed to the user with option to Approve or decline the Transaction.
3) **Step 3: User Authentication** The user completes the required authentication method with device biometrics on Trusted devices.
4) **Step 4: Verification** The app verifies the authentication data and, if successful, authorizes the requested action.
5) **Step 5: Action Completion** Upon successful authentication, the user can proceed and complete the selected high-risk transaction.
6) **Step 6: Confirmation & Logging** |

__data__.text:
* For increases above standard thresholds, users will need to follow manual BAU process.
* Users will receive SMS / Push notification confirmation once a new limit is applied.# User Journey:1) User to login to the RMB application and Navigate to the Settings section.
2) Mobile App “Usage Limits” will need to be accessible from the Settings menu (Journey Entry points to be finalized as part of the Ui/UX design flow).
3) The user is presented with a summary of their current settings (limits configured and available daily limits for users to modify).
4) User to have an option to Edit the Limits. The user should be allowed to update based on the Min and Max value allowed.
5) The Min and Max value should be parameters configured across the different transaction types – Segment wise.
6) If the user inputs a value outside allowable minimum or maximum, the app displays a contextual inline error message and guidance.
7) User should be allowed to enable these limits post Channel level 2FA Authentication (Card Pin + OTP to registered mobile number). Note: - If the requirement related to Device binding post EFR goes live before this implementation, then the updates should be only allowed for devices which are binded with EFR authentication.
8) After setting the desired transaction limits and preferences, the user to be presented with a summary of the limit updates for confirmation. The user is asked to confirm the changes before they are applied.
9) Post successful update of the transaction limits, Alerts will be triggered via SMS and Push notifications (Confirmation on the SMS/Push notification templates will be done at later stage).
10) Comprehensive audit logging of all limit changes and override requests will be implemented.
11) User who has limits already set greater than the Segment Max Value, should not be allowed to edit the limits to a value greater than the Max value i.e. if Max value is 50K and the user already has a value configured as 70 K, if customer is trying to decrease and set the value to a value between 50k to 70 K, he should not be allowed. |

Business Requirement Document (BRD)

 Commercial Bank of Dubai

 Req#

 Priorit

 Parent/Child

 Description

|          |          |        | * Pause/Resume: If supported, the user can pause or resume a subscription. Similar confirmation and SDK communication processes apply.
* Modify: The user edits linked payment details or frequency (if permitted). Changes are confirmed and updated via the Visa SDK.
* Authentication: The changes to be allowed with channel Level 2FA Authentications.
* Receive Confirmation: After any management action, the application provides a confirmation dialog and sends a push/SMS notification reflecting the action.
* Monitor Notifications: The user receives timely alerts for upcoming payments, changes, or any subscription status updates. |

__data__.text:
Classification: Internal

Business Requirement Document (BRD) Commercial Bank of Dubai

Safe Block: A security feature that allows customers to block all accounts and cards instantly via the mobile app in case of suspected fraud or loss.

Geofencing: A technology that restricts or allows app transactions to/from specific geographic locations, requiring user consent for location-based controls.

Deep Linking: A method of directing users from external apps (e.g., Samsung or Google Wallet) directly to a specific page or feature within the banking app.

IVR: Interactive Voice Response; a telephony system allowing customers to interact with automated banking services via keypad or voice commands.

TPIN: Telephone Personal Identification Number, previously used for IVR authentication, now replaced by Soft Token and security questions.

2FA: Two-Factor Authentication, a security measure requiring two different types of credentials for user verification (such as something you know and something you have).

One-Time Password (OTP): A password valid for a single login session or transaction, typically sent via SMS or generated by a Soft Token.

Masking (Data Masking): The process of obscuring sensitive data (such as account numbers) by hiding all but a few last digits/characters for security.

SWIFT/BIC: International bank codes used for identifying banks and financial institutions in cross-border transactions.

CLABE: A standardized 18-digit bank account number used for electronic transfers in Mexico.

IFSC: Indian Financial System Code, an alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies a bank branch in India.

AANI: Instant payment solution/platform supported through the mobile app.

BAU: Business As Usual; refers to standard operational procedures.

SOA: Statement of Account, a summary of financial transactions for a user’s account.

Push Notification: Real-time alerts delivered to a user’s device, used for transaction confirmations, updates, and security notifications.

Parameterization: The process of setting configurable values (such as transaction limits or thresholds) within the system.

Malware: Malicious software designed to compromise, damage, or gain unauthorized access to a device or system.

Session Suspension: Temporarily pausing a user’s active app or online session to protect data during risky scenarios (e.g., screen sharing, malware, or calls).

Re-authentication: The process of requiring a user to verify their identity again before resuming a suspended session or completing sensitive actions.

 7.3. NFR Statistics for Performance Testing

Upon a 3D Secure transaction trigger, A push notification to be triggered to user and the Mobile app shall display all relevant transaction details (merchant name, amount, date/time, and transaction reference). All                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        ', 2: ' transaction-related data must be displayed in a secure, tamper-resistant manner to prevent spoofing or manipulation. The transaction should be approved via In App approval process, Post Authentication                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ', 3: ' Authentication process:- Device biometric authentication (fingerprint, facial recognition, etc.) is required as part of the 3D Secure approval step. ', 4: ' The In-app approval screen must provide clear options for the user to approve or decline the transaction. The In App approval screen displays all relevant transaction details (merchant name, amount, date/time, and transaction reference) in bold to customer along with the below call to actions: Approved – User is displayed with the success screen which also displays the generated Soft Token value (with expiry countdown). The expiry time of the Soft token will need to be finalized during the solution phase. Decline – The 3D Secure transaction is declined, and Merchant is informed. '}}

__data__.text:
The table outlines the requirements for implementing 3D Secure transaction display and completion via in-app approvals in a mobile app. It includes a critical parent requirement and several high-priority child requirements detailing the necessary features and processes, such as device binding, secure transaction data display, biometric authentication, and user interface for transaction approval or decline.,
with the following table title:
3D Secure Transaction Requirements,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priorit: None
- Parent/child: None
- Description: None

| Req#     | Priorit  | Parent/child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-001   | Critical | Parent       | 3D Secure Transaction Display & Completion via In-App Approvals The mobile app must be enhanced to support the completion of 3D Secure e-commerce transaction via In App approval. This should be allowed only                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| FR-001.1 | High     | Child        | on devices which passed the Device binding process (Refer Req FR-002 in the below section). Upon a 3D Secure transaction trigger, A push notification to be triggered to user and the Mobile app shall display all relevant transaction details (merchant name, amount, date/time, and transaction reference). All                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| FR-001.2 | High     | Child        | transaction-related data must be displayed in a secure, tamper-resistant manner to prevent spoofing or manipulation. The transaction should be approved via In App approval process, Post Authentication                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| FR-001.3 | High     | Child        | Authentication process:- Device biometric authentication (fingerprint, facial recognition, etc.) is required as part of the 3D Secure approval step. (User should be allowed to set up Smart Pin for Authentication as part of the device Biding enablement) If the device does not support Biometrics, Then user should be able to authenticate via Smart Pin.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| FR-001.4 | High     | Child        | The In-app approval screen must provide clear options for the user to approve or decline the transaction. The In App approval screen displays all relevant transaction details (merchant name, amount, date/time, and transaction reference) in bold to customer along with the below call to actions: Approved – User is displayed with the success screen which also displays the generated Soft Token value (with expiry countdown). The expiry time of the Soft token will need to be finalized during the solution phase. Decline – The 3D Secure transaction is declined, and Merchant is informed. |

metadata.table_df:
| Req#                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | Priorit y | Parent/ child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------- | ------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| FR-001.5                                                                                                                                                                                                             | High      | Child         | If biometric authentication fails (Retry attempts to be available which should be a parameter configuration) or is unavailable, the app shall enable backup authentication via Smart Pin (User should be allowed to set up Smart Pin for Authentication as part of the device Binding enablement).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| FR-001.6                                                                                                                                                                                                             | High      | Child         | Upon user approval (either via biometric or backup Smart Pin), the app must securely communicate the approval to the 3D Secure server for transaction completion.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| FR-001.7                                                                                                                                                                                                             | High      | Child         | On successful biometrics/pin entry we should show success + show generated soft token code.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| FR-001.8                                                                                                                                                                                                             | High      | Child         | The app must clearly indicate the final status of the transaction to the user (success, failure, or error), with relevant explanations as needed. All user interactions, approvals / declines, and authentication events should be logged securely in backend tables for auditing and compliance purposes. All transaction information, Date and Time, Customer Approval / Decline preference and Authentication details and other critical information to be captured in detail.                                                               |
| FR-001.9                                                                                                                                                                                                             | High      | Child         | The 3DS page displayed to customers on Initiation of Ecommerce transactions, to be enhanced to support the In App verification option. On Initiation of 3D Secure Translation – Bank’s ACS vendor will redirect the customer to a page Rendered from ACS Vendor (This page design needs to be provided by our Design team for PING Development) and the expectation is that this Page will have all the required transaction/Merchant details displayed to the customer, with the following details enabled on the page:                        |
| * A) Transaction Information

metadata.table_df: {' Req#      ': {0: ' FR-001.11 ', 1: ' FR-002    ', 2: ' FR-002.1  ', 3: ' FR-002.2  ', 4: ' FR-002.3  '}, ' Priority ': {0: ' High     ', 1: ' Critical ', 2: ' High     ', 3: ' High     ', 4: ' High     '}, ' Parent/Child ': {0: ' Child        ', 1: ' Parent       ', 2: ' Child        ', 3: ' Child        ', 4: ' Child        '}, ' Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           ': {0: ' Token code on the 3DS Page, Soft Token is sent to CBD Authentication Vendor (PING) for Validation, Soft Token is VCAS is notified that 3DS Is Approved by user, The 3DS page displays validation completion message and journey is redirected back to Merchant. Once the Soft token is entered, following handlings to be developed on the Page: - - Error message if Soft Token has expired - Error message if soft token is Incorrect. Post 3 Times incorrect soft token entered and Validated by PING, VCAS to be notified to block the Card for Exceeding Pin tries. - Error message on Page time out. The existing Phase 1 implementation of soft token registration and generation (Refer Appendix Section 7.5 which has the Phase 1 BRD) should also continue in parallel to support customers to complete the 3D secure transactions via soft tokens. This is to support use cases where there are no internet connections / Restricted countries/ Offline mode/ if user for some reason is not receiving push notifications. ', 1: ' Implement Trusted Device integration for Mobile Banking users with EFR Authentication. The mobile app must be enhanced to support the users to register their mobile devices as trusted, linking device identity with their banking profile.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          ', 2: ' EFR Authentication Integration: The system shall employ EFR Authentication during device registration and every access attempt for robust identity verification as part of Trusted Device enablement. Device binding should never be permitted without successful EFR.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                ', 3: ' If EFR fails for any reason, the system must provide retry opportunity (Parameterized Attempts). If the retry attempt also fails, the customer should be advised as below but not limited to: • Move to a better-lit area, • Switch to a location with a stronger network connection, • Or otherwise improve their environment for EFR success.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       ', 4: ' Device Binding: The solution shall generate a unique, secure device identifier for each registered device, stored securely in the bank’s backend system to ensure that there is a deep secure connection enabled between the Device, the user and the Mobile App credentials. Note: Triggers should be sent Threatmetrix for behavioral monitoring and decisioning to allow / decline binding the device as trusted. The Secured                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      '}}

The table outlines functional requirements for a system involving 3D Secure transactions and Trusted Device integration. It includes details on priority, parent-child relationships, and descriptions of each requirement.,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/Child: None
- Description: None

| Req#      | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-001.11 | High     | Child        | Token code on the 3DS Page, Soft Token is sent to CBD Authentication Vendor (PING) for Validation, Soft Token is VCAS is notified that 3DS Is Approved by user, The 3DS page displays validation completion message and journey is redirected back to Merchant. Once the Soft token is entered, following handlings to be developed on the Page: - - Error message if Soft Token has expired - Error message if soft token is Incorrect. Post 3 Times incorrect soft token entered and Validated by PING, VCAS to be notified to block the Card for Exceeding Pin tries. - Error message on Page time out. The existing Phase 1 implementation of soft token registration and generation (Refer Appendix Section 7.5 which has the Phase 1 BRD) should also continue in parallel to support customers to complete the 3D secure transactions via soft tokens. This is to support use cases where there are no internet connections / Restricted countries/ Offline mode/ if user for some reason is not receiving push notifications. |
| FR-002    | Critical | Parent       | Implement Trusted Device integration for Mobile Banking users with EFR Authentication. The mobile app must be enhanced to support the users to register their mobile devices as trusted, linking device identity with their banking profile.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| FR-002.1  | High     | Child        | EFR Authentication Integration: The system shall employ EFR Authentication during device registration and every access attempt for robust identity verification as part of Trusted Device enablement. Device binding should never be permitted without successful EFR.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| FR-002.2  | High     | Child        | If EFR fails for any reason, the system must provide retry opportunity (Parameterized Attempts). If the retry attempt also fails, the customer should be advised as below but not limited to: • Move to a better-lit area, • Switch to a location with a stronger network connection, • Or otherwise improve their environment for EFR success.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| FR-002.3  | High     | Child        | Device Binding: The solution shall generate a unique, secure device identifier for each registered device, stored securely in the bank’s backend system to ensure that there is a deep secure connection enabled between the Device, the user and the Mobile App credentials. Note: Triggers should be sent Threatmetrix for behavioral monitoring and decisioning to allow / decline binding the device as trusted. The Secured                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

metadata.table_df: {' Req#     ': {0: ' FR-002.4 ', 1: ' FR-002.5 ', 2: ' FR-002.6 ', 3: ' FR-002.7 ', 4: ' FR-002.8 '}, ' Priority ': {0: ' High     ', 1: ' High     ', 2: ' High     ', 3: ' High     ', 4: ' High     '}, ' Parent/Child ': {0: ' Child        ', 1: ' Child        ', 2: ' Child        ', 3: ' Child        ', 4: ' Child        '}, ' Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      ': {0: ' User should be allowed to set up “Smart Pin” for Authentication at the end of the device Binding enablement. Once the device has been successfully bound using EFR, then only Smart PIN functionality should be setup for accessing through that bound device. (This Pin will be used as alternate for #D secure Authentications where device Biometric is not supported or Biometric Authentication fails – Refer FR001.3)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      ', 1: ' Multi-Device Support: Users shall have the ability to register and manage multiple trusted devices under a single banking profile, with clear visibility and revocation controls. Device Management Portal: The system shall provide a secure interface within the mobile banking app or online portal for users to disable and deregister their trusted devices. A user can register up to 2 Devices as Trusted device. When user is registering the Second device, as part of successful Registration process and first Login to the device, Device binding process to be Initiated. EFR Authentication to be initiated for any new Trusted device enablement / deregistering a device and later attempt to register the same device again. User will have to disable either of the already added devices to add a new device as trusted, i.e. only 2 trusted devices to be active at any instance. If the user tries to reenable a device as trusted (which was enabled and later disabled), user will still need to perform ERF integration. ', 2: ' Disabling of trusted devices will need to pass through EFR Authentication, and the information should be passed to Threatmetrix application for behavioral monitoring and decisioning to allow / decline binding the device as trusted. Remote Device Revocation via OPCRM: The bank shall offer the capability to remotely revoke or disable a trusted device in case of loss, theft, or suspicious activity, requiring re-authentication for future access.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    ', 3: ' Periodic Re-Authentication: Users may be periodically prompted for EFR re-authentication on trusted devices to ensure ongoing security and to mitigate session hijacking risks.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ', 4: ' Seamless User Experience: The trusted device registration and authentication processes shall be intuitive and minimally intrusive, balancing security with user convenience.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     '}}

'}}

__data__.text:
The table outlines various functional requirements related to device authentication and management for a banking application. It includes details on setting up Smart PINs, multi-device support, device management, and security measures such as EFR authentication and periodic re-authentication.,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/Child: None
- Description: None

| Req#     | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-002.4 | High     | Child        | User should be allowed to set up “Smart Pin” for Authentication at the end of the device Binding enablement. Once the device has been successfully bound using EFR, then only Smart PIN functionality should be setup for accessing through that bound device. (This Pin will be used as alternate for #D secure Authentications where device Biometric is not supported or Biometric Authentication fails – Refer FR001.3)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| FR-002.5 | High     | Child        | Multi-Device Support: Users shall have the ability to register and manage multiple trusted devices under a single banking profile, with clear visibility and revocation controls. Device Management Portal: The system shall provide a secure interface within the mobile banking app or online portal for users to disable and deregister their trusted devices. A user can register up to 2 Devices as Trusted device. When user is registering the Second device, as part of successful Registration process and first Login to the device, Device binding process to be Initiated. EFR Authentication to be initiated for any new Trusted device enablement / deregistering a device and later attempt to register the same device again. User will have to disable either of the already added devices to add a new device as trusted, i.e. only 2 trusted devices to be active at any instance. If the user tries to reenable a device as trusted (which was enabled and later disabled), user will still need to perform ERF integration. |
| FR-002.6 | High     | Child        | Disabling of trusted devices will need to pass through EFR Authentication, and the information should be passed to Threatmetrix application for behavioral monitoring and decisioning to allow / decline binding the device as trusted. Remote Device Revocation via OPCRM: The bank shall offer the capability to remotely revoke or disable a trusted device in case of loss, theft, or suspicious activity, requiring re-authentication for future access.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| FR-002.7 | High     | Child        | Periodic Re-Authentication: Users may be periodically prompted for EFR re-authentication on trusted devices to ensure ongoing security and to mitigate session hijacking risks.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| FR-002.8 | High     | Child        | Seamless User Experience: The trusted device registration and authentication processes shall be intuitive and minimally intrusive, balancing security with user convenience.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

__data__.text:
This table outlines various functional requirements (FR) related to trusted device management, including audit trails, notification systems, threat detection, secure storage, and customer journeys for device integration. It specifies priorities, parent-child relationships, and detailed descriptions for each requirement.,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/Child: None
- Description: None

| Req#      | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-002.9  | High     | Child        | Audit Trail: The solution shall maintain an immutable, time stamped audit log of all trusted device registrations, authentications, and revocations for compliance and monitoring. Audit trail should be logged and available for a minimum of 1 year from the date of initiation.                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| FR-002.10 | High     | Child        | Notification System: Users shall receive secure notifications (e.g., email, SMS, or in-app) whenever a new trusted device is registered or a device is removed from their profile.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| FR-002.11 | High     | Child        | Real-time Threat Detection: The solution shall monitor for signs of compromised devices (such as root/jailbreak detection, malware presence) and restrict access if risks are identified.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| FR-002.11 | High     | Child        | Secure Storage: All device credentials, keys, and tokens shall be securely stored with no sensitive data stored in plain text. Customer data or transaction data stored outside the UAE. CPR/CPS prohibits storage of customer and transaction data outside the UAE.                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| FR-003    | Critical | Parent       | Journeys to be enabled for Trusted Device integrated Devices New to bank customers on First Login to Mobile App to be triggered with Trusted Device enablement journey Via EFR. Post EFR verification process, the customer should be given the option to apply for digital card issuance. The digital card issuance option should be available for Credit Cards, Debit cards and Companion Accounts Mobile and Assisted Journeys (Journeys define in Appendix section 7.1.3). |
| FR-003.1  | High     | Child        | Login in web channel should not be allowed unless approved through Mobile device (via Soft Token post Device binding via EFR) to ensure that any ATO issue doesn’t lead to digital card details being shown to the fraudster. In case a digital card is activated, the physical card to be in inactive state and will need activation from customers.                                                                                                                          |
| FR-003.2  | High     | Child        | Existing to bank customers on First Login to Mobile App (post EFR Authentication enabled on the CBD Mobile App) to be triggered with Trusted Device enablement journey Via EFR. The digital card issuance option should be available for Credit Cards, Debit cards and Companion Accounts from Mobile and Assisted Journeys (Journeys define in Appendix section 7.1.3).                                                                                                       |

', 1: ' Upon detection of screen sharing, the active banking session should be suspended immediately to prevent the exposure of sensitive information.                                                                         ', 2: ' Once the session is suspended and the user is redirected to the Login page, if screen sharing is still on, user should not be allowed to generate the Soft token from the Login Page.                                  ', 3: ' The user must be notified that their session has been suspended due to the initiation of a screen share, with a clear explanation and guidance to resume the session once screen sharing has ended.                    ', 4: ' Users should be required to re-authenticate to resume the suspended session after stopping screen sharing.                                                                                                             ', 5: ' The event (session suspension due to screen share) should be logged with a timestamp and relevant session details for audit purposes.                                                                                  ', 6: ' Identification of Malicious Code/Malware (Mobile & Online Banking)                                                                                                                                                     ', 7: ' The system should continuously monitor for the presence of known malicious code or malware during active sessions.                                                                                                     ', 8: ' If malicious code or malware is detected, the active user session must be suspended immediately to protect user data and prevent unauthorized access.                                                                  ', 9: ' The user must receive an urgent notification explaining that their session has been suspended due to security concerns, along with suggestions and steps to resolve the issue (e.g., device scan, contacting support). ', 10: ' The incident must be logged with details such as type of malware detected, time of detection, and affected session.                                                                                                    ', 11: ' The user should not be able to resume the suspended session until the platform confirms that the threat has been mitigated.                                                                                            ', 12: ' Active Call on Mobile App                                                                                                                                                                                              ', 13: ' The system should detect when an active call is in progress on the same device as the mobile banking app.                                                                                                              ', 14: ' Upon detection of an active call, the banking session may either be suspended automatically or prompt the user to suspend the session for added security.                                                              ', 15: ' The user should receive a notification explaining the reason for the session suspension or suspension prompt, with clear instructions to resume once. __data__.text:
The table outlines security requirements and protocols for banking sessions, focusing on scenarios like screen sharing, malware detection, and active calls. It includes actions like session suspension, user notifications, and logging incidents for audit purposes.,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/Child: None
- Description: None

| Req#     | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|---|---|---|---|
|          |          |              | The system must automatically detect when a user initiates a screen-sharing session while logged into their banking account.                                                                                           |
|          |          |              | Upon detection of screen sharing, the active banking session should be suspended immediately to prevent the exposure of sensitive information.                                                                         |
|          |          |              | Once the session is suspended and the user is redirected to the Login page, if screen sharing is still on, user should not be allowed to generate the Soft token from the Login Page.                                  |
|          |          |              | The user must be notified that their session has been suspended due to the initiation of a screen share, with a clear explanation and guidance to resume the session once screen sharing has ended.                    |
|          |          |              | Users should be required to re-authenticate to resume the suspended session after stopping screen sharing.                                                                                                             |
|          |          |              | The event (session suspension due to screen share) should be logged with a timestamp and relevant session details for audit purposes.                                                                                  |
|          |          |              | Identification of Malicious Code/Malware (Mobile & Online Banking)                                                                                                                                                     |
|          |          |              | The system should continuously monitor for the presence of known malicious code or malware during active sessions.                                                                                                     |
|          |          |              | If malicious code or malware is detected, the active user session must be suspended immediately to protect user data and prevent unauthorized access.                                                                  |
| FR-004.2 | High     | Child        | The user must receive an urgent notification explaining that their session has been suspended due to security concerns, along with suggestions and steps to resolve the issue (e.g., device scan, contacting support). |
|          |          |              | The incident must be logged with details such as type of malware detected, time of detection, and affected session.                                                                                                    |
|          |          |              | The user should not be able to resume the suspended session until the platform confirms that the threat has been mitigated.                                                                                            |
|          |          |              | Active Call on Mobile App                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|          |          |              | The system should detect when an active call is in progress on the same device as the mobile banking app.                                                                                                              |
| FR-004.3 | High     | Child        | Upon detection of an active call, the banking session may either be suspended automatically or prompt the user to suspend the session for added security.                                                              |
|          |          |              | The user should receive a notification explaining the reason for the session suspension or suspension prompt, with clear instructions to resume once.                                                                  |
