__data__.text:
The table outlines functional requirements for a mobile app related to international remittance and transaction limit management. It includes details on beneficiary information validation and daily transaction limit viewing and updating.,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/Child: None
- Description: None

| Req#     | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-006.5 | High     | Child        | Beneficiary address Currency – Beneficiary country currency The system must highlight any mismatched or missing information that may prevent transaction processing. As part of the International Remittance initiation for Registered Beneficiary, Application must recheck the beneficiary information with Bankers Almanach and if the Beneficiary information is Invalid, user should not be allowed to complete the transaction and an appropriate message to be displayed to customer to update the Beneficiary before initiating the transactions. |
| FR-006.6 | High     | Child        | All current validations and process on Beneficiary addition to continue along with the validations.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
| FR-007   | Critical | Parent       | Channels Usage Limit Management via Mobile App Mobile App to be enhanced to allows customer to view and update daily Mobile banking usage limits for the following transaction categories:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| FR-007.1 | High     | Child        | Credit card payments, utility bill payments, Cardless Cash withdrawal Limits, AANI transfers and Remittance transactions Introduce a new section in the app’s “Settings” menu where users can:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|          |          |              | • View their current daily limits for each transaction type (credit card payments, utility bill payments, Cardless Cash withdrawal Limits, AANI transfers and Remittance transactions). • Request updates to these limits with Real-time limit enforcement of limits. • Access a summary of daily usage and remaining transaction capacity for each category.                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| FR-007.2 | High     | Child        | View Current Daily Limits • The app will display the current daily limit for each transaction type (credit card payments, utility bill payments, Cardless Cash withdrawal Limits, AANI transfers and Remittance transactions on a dedicated screen. • Each limit will be presented with clear labelling and currency symbols. • Users will see their remaining transaction capacity for the current day in each category.                                                                                                                                 |
| FR-007.3 | High     | Child        | Update Daily Limits • Users may request to increase or decrease their daily limit for any of the defined transaction type (credit card payments, utility bill payments, Cardless Cash withdrawal Limits, AANI transfers and Remittance transactions) categories.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |

'}}

__data__.text:
The table outlines various requirements and functionalities related to transaction limits, card services, and recurring payment subscription management within a banking application. It includes details on daily transaction limits, integration with backend systems, and enhancements for managing recurring payments using Visa's SDK.,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/Child: None
- Description: None

| Req#     | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|---|---|---|---|
| 12       |          |              | Daily limits for each transaction type (credit card payments, utility bill payments, Cardless Cash withdrawal Limits, AANI transfers and Remittance transactions) should be an on/off Flag in the backend to turn on/off user updates across any of the transaction type. |
| 13       |          |              | User should not be allowed to initiate any card service during the core EOD process window if there would be any use case of the limits not allowed to update during batch processing. Customer should be displayed with an adequate message in this scenario.            |
| 14       |          |              | Currently some of these limits are hosted by CLM (Centralized limit Management) Application and Few in channels side. Integrations to be done in accordance to where the limits across the listed transaction categories are currently located.                           |
| 15       |          |              | The updates submitted from the RMB channels should be logged in backend channels DB. This information should also flow to EDW DB.                                                                                                                                         |
| 16       |          |              | The functionality should be integrated across Moengage, Firebase and Adjust for end-to-end tracking on the Front end based on event configurations.                                                                                                                       |
| FR-008   | Critical | Parent       | Recurring Payment Subscription Management Mobile App to be enhanced to allows customer to view and manage their                                                                                                                                                           |
| FR-008.1 | High     | Child        | recurring payment subscriptions. This functionality to leverage and integrate with the SDK provided by Visa, ensuring compliance with Visa’s API and security standards.                                                                                                  |
|          |          |              | As part of the Recurring Payment subscription Management the following to be supported:                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|          |          |              | • Enable customers to view all active, upcoming, and past recurring payment subscriptions linked to their accounts and cards.                                                                                                                                             |
| FR-008.2 | High     | Child        | • Empower customers to manage these subscriptions (e.g., cancel, pause, resume, or modify) directly within the Banking Application.                                                                                                                                       |
|          |          |              | Out of Scope:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|          |          |              | • Subscription management for non-Visa cards and accounts.                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|          |          |              | • Merchant-side subscription setup and billing logic.                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| FR-008.3 | High     | Child        | Subscription Overview                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|          |          |              | The application shall display a dedicated section named “Recurring Payments” or similar within the user’s account dashboard.                                                                                                                                              |
|          |          |              | The system shall retrieve all recurring payment subscriptions linked to the user’s Visa cards/accounts using the Visa SDK.                                                                                                                                                |

metadata.table_df: {' Req#     ': {0: ' FR-008.4 ', 1: ' FR-008.5 '}, ' Priority ': {0: ' High     ', 1: ' High     '}, ' Parent/Child ': {0: ' Child        ', 1: ' Child        '}, ' Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              ': {0: ' Each subscription entry shall show merchant name, billing amount, frequency, next payment date, last payment date, payment method, and subscription status. Subscription Management Actions The user shall be able to cancel an active subscription. Upon cancellation, the system shall update the status in the UI and via the Visa SDK, notifying the merchant as required. The user shall be able to pause or resume a subscription, if supported by Visa and the merchant. The user shall be able to modify payment method or details associated with a subscription, where supported by the Visa SDK. The user shall be able to search for subscriptions by merchant name, amount, or date. The user shall be able to filter subscriptions by status (Active, Paused, Cancelled, Expired). Confirmation dialogs and user notifications shall be provided for all management actions. User Journey: Login: The user opens the Banking Application and logs in using their secure credentials and (if required) completes multi-factor authentication. This functionality should be allowed on binded device. Access Recurring Payments: From the Cards page, the user selects the “Recurring Payments” section. View Subscriptions List: The application retrieves and displays a list of all Visa-linked recurring payment subscriptions, each showing merchant name, billing amount, frequency, next payment date, last payment date, payment method, and status. ', 1: ' Search or Filter: The user may search for subscriptions by merchant name or filter by criteria such as status or date. Select Subscription: The user taps/clicks on a specific subscription to view detailed information. Manage Subscription: • Cancel: User selects the option to cancel. The app requests confirmation, interacts with Visa SDK to execute the cancellation, updates status, and notifies the merchant.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               '}}

__data__.text:
The table outlines functional requirements for a mobile banking application, focusing on notification features and a 'Safe Block' security feature. It includes details on the priority level and specific functionalities related to account and card blocking, user confirmation, and unaffected transactions.,
with the following columns:
- FR-008.6: None
- High: None
- Child: None
- The application shall send push/email notifications for upcoming payments, changes in status, and expiring subscriptions.: None

| -------- | -------- .1| ------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-009   | Critical | Parent | Enable “Safe Block” functionality on Mobile App Enhance the Mobile App to support “Safe Block” feature within the Banking                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| FR-009.1 | High     | Child  | Mobile App which would allow customers to block all their accounts and cards through the app, providing a robust security mechanism in situations of suspected fraud or loss.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|          |          |        | Customers must be able to access the Safe Block feature directly from the main dashboard or security settings menu in the app.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|          |          |        | Once activated, all customer accounts (savings, current, fixed deposits, etc.) and all issued cards (debit, credit, prepaid) are immediately blocked for all outgoing transactions.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| FR-009.2 | High     | Child  | Incoming transfers (such as salary credits, Payments to cards etc..) should remain unaffected to avoid customer hardship.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|          |          |        | Incoming Transaction payments (like Aani, Open Finance etc.) Outgoing DDS Payments and Cheque payments are not to be affected.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| FR-009.3 | High     | Child  | The Safe Block action should be clearly labelled and require explicit user confirmation (e.g., “Are you sure you want to block all accounts and cards?” with a ‘Yes, Block All’ button).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|          |          |        | When “Safe Block” is triggered, the following functionalities should not be allowed from the Mobile App                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| FR-009.4 | High     | Child  | New account/card openings Modifying any Customer Demographics / Contact Information / KYC information from the Mobile App.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

', 1: ' User Should be allowed to Deactivate “Safe Block” option. ', 4: ' After successful biometric authentication, all previously blocked accounts and cards (As part of the Safe Block enabling) should be fully restored for transaction activity (Cards/accounts which were blocked by call centre/fraud desk teams not be updated). Performance: Blocking and unblocking actions must occur within 5 seconds under normal network conditions. System must be able to handle high concurrency during crisis or fraud spike events. ', 5: ' Audit Trail: All Safe Block actions (initiation, completion, errors) must be logged with timestamp and device details. Logs must capture customer ID, device information, geolocation (with consent), timestamps, and action results.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         ', 6: ' Notifications: On activation and De Activation SMS communications to be sent to the customers.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                ', 7: ' Implement Geofencing enablement via Channels. ', 8: ' The system shall allow users to opt in/out of geofencing features within the app settings. The app to request explicit user consent for location tracking and geofencing functionalities.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     '}}

The table outlines various functional requirements (FR) related to security features, biometric authentication, and geofencing in a mobile application. It includes details on modifying security settings, deactivating and unblocking features with biometric authentication, maintaining audit trails, and sending notifications. Additionally, it covers geofencing enablement and user consent for location tracking.,
with the following table title:
Functional Requirements for Security and Geofencing,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/Child: None
- Description: None

| Req#      | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-009.5  | High     | Child        | Modifying Security functions like Password, Soft token enablement, customer preferences in Settings page.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| FR-009.6  | High     | Child        | User Should be allowed to Deactivate “Safe Block” option. De-Activation to request to be completed post with Emirates Facial Recognition (EFR) biometric authentication.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| FR-009.7  | High     | Child        | Customer should not be allowed to unblock the Accounts and Cards with the BAU unblock process when blocked due to “Safe Block” initiation without Deactivating the “Safe Block”.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|           |          |              | Safe Block Unblocking • Unblocking can only be completed with Authentication via Emirates Facial Recognition (EFR) system • The app should prompt the user to initiate the EFR process, followed by the device’s own biometric authentication flow. • If EFR or biometric verification fails, access must remain blocked, and the customer should be directed to customer support for manual assistance via OPCRM (Current unblock triggers to unblock Block Cards/ Accounts and Channels to be enhanced to support this requirement as Backup).                                                                                                              |
| FR-009.8  | High     | Child        | After successful biometric authentication, all previously blocked accounts and cards (As part of the Safe Block enabling) should be fully restored for transaction activity (Cards/accounts which were blocked by call centre/fraud desk teams not be updated). All the channel level restrictions placed should also be Re-Instated. • Send confirmation notifications (push/SMS/email) on successful unblock. • Maintain an audit trail of unblocking events. Performance: Blocking and unblocking actions must occur within 5 seconds under normal network conditions. System must be able to handle high concurrency during crisis or fraud spike events. |
| FR-009.9  | High     | Child        | Audit Trail: All Safe Block actions (initiation, completion, errors) must be logged with timestamp and device details. Logs must capture customer ID, device information, geolocation (with consent), timestamps, and action results.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| FR-009.10 | High     | Child        | Notifications: On activation and De Activation SMS communications to be sent to the customers.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| FR-010    | Critical | Parent       | Implement Geofencing enablement via Channels. Enhance the Mobile App to enable an application to allow Mobile App Transactions from specific Geo Locations.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| FR-010.1  | High     | Child        | The system shall allow users to opt in/out of geofencing features within the app settings. The app to request explicit user consent for location tracking and geofencing functionalities.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

This table outlines functional requirements for a mobile application, focusing on location tracking, geofencing, and wallet integration with Samsung and Google Pay. It includes details on user consent, data transparency, geofence management, event detection, and wallet extension capabilities.,
with the following columns:

- Priority: None

| Req#     | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-010.1 | High     | Child        | The app shall request explicit user consent for location tracking and geofencing functionalities during onboarding and whenever privacy policies change.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| FR-010.2 | High     | Child        | The app shall provide transparent information about how location data will be used, stored, and protected. Users shall be able to revoke or modify consent for geofencing at any time within the app.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| FR-010.3 | High     | Child        | Geofence Creation and Management: Application to Allow Mobile App users to define geofences (locations and activation times) via the Mobile App on bounded Devices. The system shall support multiple concurrent geofences per user, such as home, workplace, and bank locations. The system allows users to opt in/out of geofencing features within the app settings. On enablement, the app shall provide clear explanations and feedback about geofencing activities and actions taken. The system shall update active geofences dynamically based on user profile changes or bank policy updates. |
| FR-010.4 | High     | Child        | Event Detection and Notification: The system shall detect when a user’s access device outside geofenced area in real time, with minimal latency. The app shall prompt EFR authentication (e.g., biometric verification) when a user attempts to Turn on or Off Geolocations. The app shall prompt EFR authentication (e.g., biometric verification) when a user attempts sensitive actions (e.g., fund transfers) outside predefined geofenced locations. The app offer users control over notification preferences (push notifications).                                                              |
| FR-011   | Critical | Parent       | Enable Wallet extension via Samsung and Google pay                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| FR-011.1 | High     | Child        | Samsung & Google Wallet Integration: The banking application must support seamless integration with Samsung & Google Wallet, allowing users to add and manage their banking cards or credentials directly within Samsung & Google Wallet.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| FR-011.2 | High     | Child        | Wallet Extension Capability: Implement a wallet extension that enables Registration of Debit and Credit cards accessible through Samsung & Google Wallet.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| FR-011.3 | High     | Child        | Redirection Mechanism: Upon triggering specific actions in the Samsung & Google Wallet extension (e.g., tapping a card or alert), users should be securely redirected to the banking application for further actions or detailed information.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |

__data__.text:
The table outlines various functional requirements for a banking application, focusing on features like deep linking, user authentication, permission management, error handling, compatibility, regulatory compliance, notification templates, eligibility, data capture, and push notifications.,
with the following columns:
- Req#: None
- Priority: None
- Parent/Child: None
- Description: None

| Req#     | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-011.4 | High     | Child        | The banking app must implement deep linking to facilitate direct navigation from Samsung & Google Wallet to specific sections within the app, providing a smooth user experience.                                                                                                         |
| FR-011.5 | High     | Child        | User Authentication: Ensure secure authentication processes when redirecting from Samsung & Google Wallet to the banking application, using Face ID, Touch ID, User ID and password for Login.                                                                                            |
| FR-011.6 | High     | Child        | Permission & Consent Management: Prompt users to grant necessary permissions for accessing and sharing information between Samsung & Google Wallet and the banking application, with clear consent dialogs.                                                                               |
| FR-011.7 | High     | Child        | Error Handling & Fallbacks: Implement comprehensive error handling for cases where redirection fails, the banking app is not installed, or network issues occur—providing user-friendly messages and alternative options.                                                                 |
| FR-011.8 | High     | Child        | Compatibility & Testing: Ensure the solution is compatible with the latest versions and Samsung & Google Wallet APIs, and conduct extensive testing for various devices and user scenarios.                                                                                               |
| FR-011.9 | High     | Child        | Regulatory Compliance: Adhere to all relevant financial, technological, and regional regulations for digital wallets, banking apps, and payment systems, including regular security reviews and updates.                                                                                  |
| FR-012   | Critical | Parent       | SMS & Push Notification Templates                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| FR-012.1 | High     | Child        | SMS / Push Notification templates will be finalized on the solution phase as part of the UI/UX Journey finalization.                                                                                                                                                                      |
| FR-013   | Critical | Parent       | Eligibility Requirements                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| FR-013.1 | High     | Child        | Applicable only to users who have registered for Mobile App.                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| FR-013.2 | High     | Child        | Applicable to all segments - Personal, Elite, Private & Staff - Users who have registered for RMB.                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| FR-013.3 | High     | Child        | Should be supported for Arabic & English Journeys on the Mobile App.                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| FR-013.4 | High     | Child        | All features listed should have a toggle on/off switch to make the feature unavailable to all the users if required.                                                                                                                                                                      |
| FR-014   | Critical | Parent       | EDW Requirements                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| FR-014.1 | High     | Child        | The requirement as part of the project is to capture all the data in EDW database. To be detailed during the solution phase. Business units to raise BICC Innotas’ request to obtain reports required.                                                                                    |
| FR-015   | Critical | Parent       | Enabling Push Notifications for Non-Financial Transactions & Marketing communications and all mobile App Notifications currently sent as SMS. Enhance the Mobile App to enable an option to allow Non-Financial Transactions & Marketing communications and all mobile App Notifications. |
| FR-015.1 | High     | Child        | to be sent to customers via Push Notifications. Please refer to Appendix section 7.6 for the list of non-financial transactions.                                                                                                                                                          |
| FR-015.2 | High     | Child        | Mobile App to Allow users to subscribe/unsubscribe to for Non-Financial Transactions & Marketing communications and all mobile App Notifications from the Setting section.                                                                                                                |

The table outlines various functional requirements (FR) for an application, focusing on user notifications and IVR enhancements. It includes details on priority, parent/child relationships, and specific descriptions of each requirement.,
with the following columns:

| Req#     | Priority | Parent/Child | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|---|---|---|---|
| FR-015.3 | High     | Child        | The app must obtain explicit user consent to enable push notifications for Non-Financial Transactions & Marketing communications and all mobile App Notifications to be sent to customers via Push Notifications. |
| FR-015.3 | High     | Child        | Maintain an in-app center where users can review the last 90 days (or configurable period) of received notifications.                                                                                             |
| FR-015.4 | High     | Child        | Allow users to set quiet hours or mute notifications to reduce disturbance.                                                                                                                                       |
| FR-015.5 | High     | Child        | Support multi-language notifications and personalize content using customer name or profile data. User should be able to select the Language preference.                                                          |
| FR-016   | Critical | Parent       | IVR related enhancements to replace journeys where SMS OTP is sent to customers along with alternate solution for TPIN.                                                                                           |
| FR-016.1 | High     | Child        | Identify a solution to replace the current TPIN authentication mechanism in the various segments IVRs setup where TPIN is used as a mode of authentication.                                                       |
| FR-016.2 | High     | Child        | Identify a solution to replace the current SMS OTP with a solution that provides a 2nd factor of authentication for high risk transaction, including and not limited to fund transfers and bill payment.          |

': {0: ' The process by which users approve or reject transactions directly within the mobile application, utilizing device security features.                                        ', 1: ' The process of securely associating a user’s mobile device with their banking profile, ensuring that only trusted devices can be used for sensitive operations. ', 5: ' A user device that has completed secure registration and authentication and is authorized for use in high-value and high-risk banking actions. __data__.text:
This table provides definitions and explanations of various security and transaction management terms and features used in online and mobile banking.,
with the following table title:
Security and Transaction Management Terms,
with the following columns:
- 3D Secure (3DS): None
- In-App Approval: None
- Device Binding: None
- Biometric Authentication: None
- Smart Pin: None
- Soft Token: None
- Trusted Device: None
- EFR Authentication: None
- Device Management Portal: None
- OPCRM: None
- Audit Trail: None
- High-Risk Transactions: None
- High-Value Transactions: None
- Channel Level 2FA Authentication: None
- Beneficiary: None
- Bankers Almanach: None
- CLM: None
- EDW: None
- Moengage / Firebase / Adjust: None
- Recurring Payment Subscription: None
- Visa SDK: None

| **3D Secure (3DS)**                  | An additional security protocol for online card transactions, providing real-time authentication to prevent fraud.                                                           |
|---|---|
| **In-App Approval**                  | The process by which users approve or reject transactions directly within the mobile application, utilizing device security features.                                        |
| **Device Binding**                   | The process of securely associating a user’s mobile device with their banking profile, ensuring that only trusted devices can be used for sensitive operations.              |
| **Biometric Authentication**         | Identification methods using unique biological traits, such as fingerprint or facial recognition, to verify user identity.                                                   |
| **Smart Pin**                        | A user-defined personal identification number (PIN) is used as a backup authentication method when biometrics are unavailable or fail.                                       |
| **Soft Token**                       | A software-based security token that generates time-limited one-time passwords (OTP) for transaction authentication on mobile devices.                                       |
| **Trusted Device**                   | A user device that has completed secure registration and authentication and is authorized for use in high-value and high-risk banking actions.                               |
| **EFR Authentication**               | Emirates Facial Recognition Authentication, a biometric security feature leveraging facial recognition to authenticate users.                                                |
| **Device Management Portal**         | A secure interface (within the app or online) allowing users to manage, disable, or deregister trusted devices.                                                              |
| **OPCRM**                            | Operational Customer Relationship Management platform, referenced here for remote device revocation and customer support processes.                                          |
| **Audit Trail**                      | An immutable, time-stamped log of all authentications, registration, transaction, and security events for compliance and monitoring.                                         |
| **High-Risk Transactions**           | Non-financial or financial activities classified as high-risk, such as password changes, device registration, or revealing card details, based on potential security impact. |
| **High-Value Transactions**          | Financial transactions exceeding a defined monetary threshold (e.g., above AED 10,000), requiring enhanced authentication.                                                   |
| **Channel Level 2FA Authentication** | Two-factor authentication enforced at the specific transaction channel (e.g., app or web), combining factors like Card PIN and OTP.                                          |
| **Beneficiary**                      | An individual or entity designated to receive funds via transfer, whose information must be registered and validated within the system.                                      |
| **Bankers Almanach**                 | A reference database used for real-time validation of beneficiary banking information (bank names, SWIFT/BIC codes, etc.).                                                   |
| **CLM**                              | Centralized Limit Management; a system for managing, enforcing, and integrating transaction limits across banking channels.                                                  |
| **EDW**                              | Enterprise Data Warehouse, a centralized repository for storing and analyzing data, including transaction and limit updates.                                                 |
| **Moengage / Firebase / Adjust**     | Third-party analytics and engagement platforms used for push notifications, event tracking, and user engagement metrics within the mobile app.                               |
| **Recurring Payment Subscription**   | An automatic, periodic payment set up for services or merchants, managed and displayed within the banking app.                                                               |
| **Visa SDK**                         | A software development kit provided by Visa, enabling secure integration of recurring payment management features within the mobile app.                                     |
